intro: Oncostemum macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited oncostemum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with opposite arrangement and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive, woody fruits that are typically oblong in shape. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
